intro: Cystopus hatumetensis, commonly known as the Ethiopian thornapple, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that contain seeds enclosed in a fleshy, colorful pulp. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
